page.title: 11EASTHORPE CHURCH.
page.content: Easthorpe Church is the same today as it has been for very many years.Much restoration has been carried out over the years.It was damaged by a bomb in the 2nd world war.Its overall character has probably altered over the centuries but it is still an important English building.The church is very plain and was built in the 12th century.The first Rector in the church was in 1395.There are two stained glass windows hanging in frames;the rest of the windows are quite small compared with a bigger church.The key to open the church is very big and heavy.There are 34 kneelers all embroidered by people in the village.On one of the walls there is a water colour painting that shows how the original 12th century church may have looked.
